description: From French vestige, from Latin vestīgium (“footstep, footprint, track, the sole of the foot, a trace, mark”).

entries.meaning: A mark left on the earth by a foot.
examples: Synonyms: trace, sign, track, footstep, footprint

entries.meaning: (by extension) A faint mark or visible sign left by something which is lost, or has perished, or is no longer present.
examples: the vestiges of ancient magnificence in Palmyra

entries.meaning: (biology) A vestigial organ; a non-functional organ or body part that was once functional in an evolutionary ancestor.
examples: Any person seeing such a condition could not help being frightened at the conditions found, and it seems to me that that fact should lead us to think that the appendix is a vestige or becoming so.
